TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: ka sitsuayan izua za Taruvar i pairang; avan azua kakalipatan nua załum.
ka sicoayan izoa za Tarovar i pairang; avan azoa kakalipatan noa zaljom.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a monster Taruvar on the plains, and all the water went in there.

S.FORM: manu małupetj azua angał ni Taruvar.
mano maljopetj azoa angalj ni Tarovar.
matevuk a załum; meqatsa azua załum.
matevok a zaljom; meqaca azoa zaljom.
S.TRANSL: The water accumulated; and the water level rose.

S.FORM: azua keḍikeḍian a gade malimu tua załum tua kinaqatsa.
azoa kedrikedrian a gade malimo toa zaljom toa kinaqaca.
S.TRANSL: The smaller mountains were all covered because of the great volume of water.

S.FORM: amin anga i Tumapalapalai kata i Palasidang kata i Kavulungan inika namalimu ta załum.
amin anga i Tomapalapalai kata i Palasidang kata i Kavolongan inika namalimo ta zaljom.
S.TRANSL: Only Tumapalapalai, Palasidang and Kavulungan mountains were not covered by the water.

S.FORM: azua tsautsau a se Kapayuanan sema zua i Tumapalapalai.
azoa caocao a se Kapayoanan sema zoa i Tomapalapalai.
S.TRANSL: The people of Kapayuanan went to Tumapalapalai.

S.FORM: izua neka nu sapuy.
izoa neka no sapoy.
izua za takets; sekaułan nua tsautsau pasa zua kisapuy tua Palasidang azua takets, a sema zua i Palasidang a łemanguy uta pasa maza; mangtjez i Tumapalapalai.
izoa za takec; sekaoljan noa caocao pasa zoa kisapoy toa Palasidang azoa takec, a sema zoa i Palasidang a ljemangoy ota pasa maza; mangtjez i Tomapalapalai.
S.TRANSL: There was a muntjac, and the people sent it to Palasidang to get some fire. The muntjac swam there to Palasidang andcame back here to Tumapalapalai.

S.FORM: kemsanga azua (i) Tumapalapalai.
kemsanga azoa (i) Tomapalapalai.
S.TRANSL: And so they could cook on Tumapalapalai.

S.FORM: ka tsuatsuay anga masułupetj azua angał ni Taruvar; masutevuk anga; mekeḍi anga a załum.
ka coacoay anga masoljopetj azoa angalj ni Tarovar; masotevok anga; mekedri anga a zaljom.
S.TRANSL: After a long time the mouth of Taruvar was unblocked, the water drained away, and the water level went down.

S.FORM: izua za qatjulał masekelay tua kasiw; djumaken nua mamazangiłan.
izoa za qatjolalj masekelay toa kasiw; djomaken noa mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: There were worms hanging on the trees. The chiefs found them

S.FORM: paquzipen tua lami nua mamazangiłan.
paqozipen toa lami noa mamazangiljan.
azua qatjulał nu tjeqatsang, masan qipu.
azoa qatjolalj no tjeqacang, masan qipo.
S.TRANSL: When the worms defecated, it became soil.

S.FORM: avan anga sika izua nu sa qipu.
avan anga sika izoa no sa qipo.
S.TRANSL: That’s the reason there is soil;

S.FORM: saka aitsu a kadjunangan azua sika nu mamazangiłan, ayatua tiamadju a napaquzip ta qatjulał.
saka aico a kadjonangan azoa sika no mamazangiljan, ayatoa tiamadjo a napaqozip ta qatjolalj.
S.TRANSL: and that’s the reason why all the land belongs to the chiefs, because they fed the worms.
